>So you'd write 
  assertTrue("someBoolean is n=
ot true!", someBoolean);

>Or as another example
    assertEquals("The answ=
er isn't the same!", expected, actual);



Probably best to replace 'someBo=
olean' or 'answer' with the idea of what you
are testing, as in 'The surnam=
e did not match the one I was looking for'.
Or, 'The ages of the clients ar=
e not equal'.

I am sure you probably have quite a few booleans in your cod=
e that you are
checking, but JB's suggestion was to put something meaningfu=
l that you can
come back and recognise when debugging later on.  Having jus=
t 'someBoolean'
does not really tell you much does it... 
Having an individ=
ual description will let you know exactly where the failure
occurred, but c=
reates just that little bit of overhead when creating the
assertion itself.=



Regards
